00041 class CSoundResource;
00042 
00044 // SoundType Description
00045 //
00046 // This is an enum that represents the different kinds of sound data
00047 // streams the sound system can handle.
00048 //
00050 
00051 enum SoundType
00052 {
00053         SOUND_TYPE_FIRST,
00054         SOUND_TYPE_MP3 = SOUND_TYPE_FIRST,
00055         SOUND_TYPE_WAVE,
00056         SOUND_TYPE_MIDI,
00057         SOUND_TYPE_OGG,
00058 
00059         // This needs to be the last sound type
00060         SOUND_TYPE_COUNT,
00061         SOUND_TYPE_UNKNOWN,
00062 };
00063 
00064 extern TCHAR *gSoundExtentions[];
00065 
00067 // IAudioBuffer Description
00068 //
00069 // The interface class that defines the public API for audio buffers.
00070 // An audio buffer maps to one instance of a sound being played, 
00071 // which ISNT the sound data. Two different sounds can be played from
00072 // the same source data - such as two explosions in two different places.
00074 
00075 class IAudioBuffer
00076 {
00077 public:
00078         virtual ~IAudioBuffer() { }
00079 
00080         virtual void *VGet()=0;
00081         virtual shared_ptr<CSoundResource> const VGetResource()=0;
00082         virtual bool VOnRestore()=0;
00083 
00084         virtual bool VPlay(int volume, bool looping)=0;
00085         virtual bool VStop()=0;
00086         virtual bool VResume()=0;
00087 
00088         virtual bool VTogglePause()=0;
00089         virtual bool VIsPlaying()=0;
00090         virtual bool VIsLooping() const=0;
00091         virtual void VSetVolume(int volume)=0;
00092         virtual int VGetVolume() const=0;
00093         virtual float VGetProgress()=0;
00094 };
00095 
00097 // CAudioBuffer Description
00098 //
00099 // Implements IAudiobuffer interface using a smart pointer to CSoundResource.
00100 //
00102 
00103 class CAudioBuffer : IAudioBuffer
00104 {
00105 public: 
00106         virtual shared_ptr<CSoundResource> const VGetResource() { return m_Resource; }
00107         virtual bool VIsLooping() const { return m_isLooping; }
00108         virtual int VGetVolume() const { return m_Volume; }
00109 protected:
00110         CAudioBuffer(shared_ptr<CSoundResource> const resource) 
00111                 { m_Resource = resource; 
00112                   m_isPaused = false;
00113                   m_isLooping = false;
00114                   m_Volume = 0;
00115                 }       // disable public construction
00116 
00117         shared_ptr<CSoundResource> m_Resource;
00118 
00119         // Is the sound paused
00120         bool m_isPaused;
00121 
00122         // Is the sound looping
00123         bool m_isLooping;
00124 
00125         //the volume
00126         int m_Volume;
00127 };
00128 
00129 
00131 // IAudio Description
00132 //
00133 // This interface class describes the public interface for 
00134 // a game's audio system. 
00136 
00137 class IAudio
00138 {
00139 public:
00140         virtual bool VActive()=0;
00141 
00142         virtual IAudioBuffer *VInitAudioBuffer(shared_ptr<CSoundResource> soundResource)=0;
00143         virtual void VReleaseAudioBuffer(IAudioBuffer* audioBuffer)=0;
00144 
00145         virtual void VStopAllSounds()=0;
00146         virtual void VPauseAllSounds()=0;
00147         virtual void VResumeAllSounds()=0;
00148 
00149         virtual bool VInitialize(HWND hWnd)=0;
00150         virtual void VShutdown()=0;
00151 };
00152 
00154 // AudioBufferList Description
00155 //
00156 // This is the data structure of audio buffers managed by CAudio.
00158 
00159 typedef std::list<IAudioBuffer *> AudioBufferList;
00160 
00162 // CAudio Description
00163 //
00164 // Implements IAudio interface - but not all the way - this is 
00165 // still a base class. See class CDirectSoundAudio.
00166 // 
00168 
00169 class CAudio : public IAudio
00170 {
00171 public:
00172         CAudio();
00173         virtual void VStopAllSounds();
00174         virtual void VPauseAllSounds();
00175         virtual void VResumeAllSounds();
00176 
00177         virtual void VShutdown();
00178 
00179         static TCHAR const * const FindExtFromSoundType(SoundType type) 
00180                 { return gSoundExtentions[type]; }
00181         static SoundType FindSoundTypeFromFile(TCHAR const * const ext);
00182         static bool HasSoundCard(void);
00183 
00184 protected:
00185         
00186         AudioBufferList m_AllSamples;   // List of all currently allocated
00187         bool m_AllPaused;                               // Has the sound system been paused?
00188         bool m_Initialized;                             // Has the sound system been initialized?
00189 };
00190 
00191 extern CAudio *g_Audio;
